intro: Bolusanthus speciosus, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Bolusanthus speciosus typically grows in coastal areas and prefers well-drained soils. Its foliage is often evergreen, with lance-shaped leaves that provide a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms.
